org.platanios.learn.math.matrix

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.math.matrix.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a class representing matrices and supporting operations related to matrices. Matrices are stored in an internal two-dimensional array. TODO: Make the Matrix class serializable -- well, not exactly -- look at the Vector classes for details. We need a constructor that takes a stream as input and a write to stream function, along with an equals() and a hashCode() function. TODO: Allow transposing all matrix arguments. TODO: Implement the outer product update: A = A + xy^T. TODO: Implement the matrix-matrix update: C = C + AB.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

      • computeL1Norm

        public double computeL1Norm()
        Computes the \(L_1\) norm of this matrix. Denoting this matrix by \(A\in\mathbb{R}^{m\times n}\), its element at row \(i\) and column \(j\) by \(A_{ij}\) and its \(L_1\) norm by \(\|A\|_1\), we have that: \[\|A\|_1=\max_{1\leq j\leq n}{\sum_{i=1}^m{\left|A_{ij}\right|}},\] which is the maximum absolute column sum of the matrix.
        Returns:
        The \(L_1\) norm of this matrix.

      • computeL2Norm

        public double computeL2Norm()
        Computes the \(L_2\) norm of this matrix. The \(L_2\) norm of a matrix is equal to its largest singular value. For square matrices, the \(L_2\) norm is also known as the spectral norm.
        Returns:
        The \(L_2\) norm of this matrix.

      • computeLInfinityNorm

        public double computeLInfinityNorm()
        Computes the \(L_\infty\) norm of this matrix. Denoting this matrix by \(A\in\mathbb{R}^{m\times n}\), its element at row \(i\) and column \(j\) by \(A_{ij}\) and its \(L_\infty\) norm by \(\|A\|_\infty\), we have that: \[\|A\|_\infty=\max_{1\leq i\leq m}{\sum_{j=1}^n{\left|A_{ij}\right|}},\] which is the maximum absolute row sum of the matrix.
        Returns:
        The \(L_\infty\) norm of this matrix.

      • computeFrobeniusNorm

        public double computeFrobeniusNorm()
        Computes the Frobenius norm of this matrix. Denoting this matrix by \(A\in\mathbb{R}^{m\times n}\), its element at row \(i\) and column \(j\) by \(A_{ij}\) and its Frobenius norm by \(\|A\|_F\), we have that: \[\|A\|_F=\sqrt{\sum_{i=1}^m{\sum_{j=1}^n{A_{ij}^2}}}.\]
        Returns:
        The Frobenius norm of this matrix.

        public Matrix computeFunctionResult(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> function)

        Left-divides the current matrix with another matrix element-wise and replaces the current matrix with the result.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix to left-divide with the current matrix element-wise.

      • multiply

        public Matrix multiply(double scalar)
        Multiplies the current matrix with a scalar and returns the result in a new matrix.
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar with which to multiply the current matrix.
        Returns:
        A new matrix holding the result of the multiplication.

      • multiplyEquals

        public void multiplyEquals(double scalar)
        Multiplies the current matrix with a scalar and replaces the current matrix with the result.
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar with which to multiply the current matrix.

        Divides the current matrix with a scalar and returns the result in a new matrix.

        Returns:
        A new matrix holding the result of the division.

        public void divideEquals(double scalar)
        Divides the current matrix with a scalar and replaces the current matrix with the result.
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar with which to divide the current matrix.

      • multiply

        public Vector multiply(Vector vector)
        Multiplies the current matrix with a vector and returns the result in a new vector. The resulting vector type (i.e., dense, sparse, etc.) is the same as the type of the provided vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector with which to multiply the current matrix.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of the multiplication.

      • multiply

        public Matrix multiply(Matrix matrix)
        Multiplies the current matrix with another matrix and returns the result in a new matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix with which to multiply the current matrix.
        Returns:
        A new matrix holding the result of the multiplication.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The inner dimensions of the matrices must agree.

      • solve

        public Vector solve(Vector vector)
             throws SingularMatrixException
        Solves the linear system of equations \(A\boldsymbol{x}=\boldsymbol{b}\) for \(\boldsymbol{x}\) and returns the result as a new vector. The current matrix "plays" the role of \(A\) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) is the provided vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - Vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in equation \(A\boldsymbol{x}=\boldsymbol{b}\).
        Returns:
        The solution of the system of equations.
        Throws:
        SingularMatrixException

      • solve

        public Matrix solve(Matrix matrix)
             throws SingularMatrixException
        Solves the linear system of equations \(AX=B\) for \(X\) and returns the result as a new vector. The current matrix "plays" the role of \(A\) and \(B\) is the provided matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix \(B\) in equation \(AX=B\).
        Returns:
        The solution of the system of linear equations.
        Throws:
        SingularMatrixException

      • generateIdentityMatrix

        public static Matrix generateIdentityMatrix(int dimension)
        Constructs and returns a square identity matrix with the provided dimension.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The dimension of the identity matrix (note that the row dimension and the column dimension are equal in this case because the identity matrix is square).
        Returns:
        An identity matrix with the given dimension.

      • generateDiagonalMatrix

        public static Matrix generateDiagonalMatrix(double[] diagonal)
        Constructs and returns a diagonal matrix whose diagonal elements match the provided one-dimensional array elements.
        Parameters:
        diagonal - One-dimensional array containing the diagonal matrix elements.
        Returns:
        A diagonal matrix with the provided diagonal elements on its diagonal.

      • generateRandomMatrix

        public static Matrix generateRandomMatrix(int rowDimension,
                                          int columnDimension)
        Constructs and returns a random matrix. The returned matrix contains random values ranging from 0.0 to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        rowDimension - The row dimension of the random matrix.
        columnDimension - The column dimension of the random matrix.
        Returns:
        A matrix that contains random values ranging from 0.0 to 1.0.

      • checkMatrixDimensions

        private void checkMatrixDimensions(Matrix matrix)
        Checks whether the provided matrix has the same dimensions as this matrix. If the dimensions of the two matrices do not agree an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix whose dimensions to check.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Matrix dimensions must agree.
